description: This Dart source file defines a singleton API client class (`ApiClient`) that manages HTTP communications with a backend server. It handles token management, configuration of request headers, and provides methods for generic HTTP requests (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), along with response parsing and error handling.

classes.name: ApiClient
classes.description: A singleton class that handles network requests, token management, and configuration of request headers to communicate with the backend API.

classes.name: ApiResponse
classes.description: A generic class encapsulating the response from API requests, including success data or error information.

methods.name: setToken
methods.description: Sets the authentication token used in request headers.

methods.name: token
methods.description: Getter for retrieving the current authentication token.

methods.name: request
methods.description: Performs an HTTP request with specified method, path, optional body, query parameters, headers, and whether authentication is required.
